posts.name: Tyson Whelan
posts.cooked: Make sure you are using the Phoenix 6 vendor dependency as well as phoenix 6 firmware for all of your ctre devices. If you are using Phoenix 6 everywhere, could you provide the entire error message (the message says to scroll up for more information)?

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked:
The error is here in the log:

The reason youâ€™re not getting useful error information from Gradle is because of the special characters in the path, which apparently arenâ€™t output in UTF-8 and thus Java canâ€™t parse it back in to output it.  If you rename the folders that should fix Gradle outputting errors correctly.

The underlying problem is that itâ€™s not finding the CTRE headers.  Have you installed the CTRE 2024 vendor dep JSON in your project?

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: Do not recommend to share --debug logs. They can contain security sensitive info, including passwords in plain text.

posts.name: Thad House
posts.cooked: Yup. --info logs are fine, --debug logs are not.

posts.name: Livia Moreira
posts.cooked: We didnâ€™t know that. Thank you for letting us know!
